info.name: openweathermap.org/current
info.description:
I had to write few test scenarios for website openweathermap.org/current.

First of all, i have read discription about given parameters requests should return some data, depends on parameters entered. So, i chossen to check given main parameters like authorization - how it works with correct API key and with incorrect one. 
City ID checked with different possibilities: correct city id, when inserting letter, or negative number. 
City name - tested different possible form mode-html, xml, json. how does it work.
ZIP code- tested negative and positive flows.
Count(cnt) of cities - checked returns correct data when given correct data and when inccorrect.
Bbox bounding box [lon-left,lat-bottom,lon-right,lat-top,zoom]-  
I checked too how it works when deleted one of url parameters - 2.5 - i guess it is one off internal server parameters. - response returns authorization error, severity - 3. 
My observation briefly : the main 
discrepancy between response error code and error message - it could be more accurate. 
p.s. Where are so many test scenarios to check various values, just need much more time.

item.name: Request should return correct data when authorization API key is correct

request.description: Test for check is correct data response when API key is correct.Test flow positive.

response.name: Request should return correct data when authorization API key is correct

item.name: Request should return authorization error when  API key is incorrect

request.description: Test for check is response returns authorization error when API key is incorrect. Test pass

response.name: Request should return authorization error when  API key is incorrect

item.name: Request should return corect data when city id is correct

request.description: Test for check is correct data response when city id is correct.Test float possitive.

response.name: Request should return corect data when city id is correct

item.name: Request should return validation error bad request when city id  is letter or negative number, but response just skips bad  requests, but counts like it's one of city IDs

exec: pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.include("id list must be in range from 1 to 20");

request.description:
1. Request should return validatione error bad request with a letter or negative number, or mixed(numbers with letters) id number, but there no any reaction, just ignore that id number is invalid. 
Should return validation error - bad request, city ID should be a float. 
2. This test should check is it realy returns error message with too long requested list and to check is the program counts all "city IDs" given no metter is it valid or not.
All given "city IDs" counts like valid, and returns message error with too long list of cities IDs (the range between 1-20).
3. The same city ID number indicated like new one. It should not be.

response.name: Request should return validation error bad request when city id  is letter or negative number, but response just skips bad  requests, but counts like it's one of city IDs
Request should return validation error bad request when city id  is letter or negative number, but response just skips bad  requests, but counts like it's one of city IDs

item.name: Request should return message error bad request with negative  id number, but response just skip bad  negative request

request.description:
Request should return message error bad request with negative  id number, but there no any reaction, just ignore id number with negative meaning.
Should return message error - bad request, negative id not allowed.

response.name: Request should return message error bad request with negative  id number, but response just skip bad  negative request
Request should return message error bad request with negative  id number, but response just skip bad  negative request

item.name: Request should return corect data when city name is correct/xml mode

request.description: I made some random generation: random Cities, random language code, random units for temperature and random mode for xml, html and json formats. It seems works good.

item.name: Request should return validation error when city name is not given

request.description: Request without city name (empty) returns status code 400 us a bad request, but it could be error message like - "City name is required".

response.name: Request should return validation error when city name is not given
Request should return validation error when city name is not given

item.name: Request should return correct data when ZIP code is correct

request.description: Give correct zip code to check test result is it correct. Status code 200, returns correct data. For example If changing US to UK:result-not found, bad request.

response.name: Request should return correct data when ZIP code is correct

item.name: Request should return validation error when ZIP code is incorrect

exec: pm.test("Error code should be 400, but not 404", function () {
pm.test("Error message should be bad request, but not city not found", function () {

request.description: Zip code dosn't have limits. Would be nice to get message with limit of digits. It's possible to enter negative numbers and message error the same - bad request(404).

response.name: Request should return validation error when ZIP code is incorrect

item.name: Request should return 10 by default cities if cnt is not given

request.description: This request returns response with random generated cities number(from 1-50). By default should return 10 cities, if number from 1 til 50 is not chosen, but default returns only 5 cities, but not 10 us is described in API documentation.

response.name: Request should return 10 by default cities if cnt is not given

item.name: Request should return error message with square degrees limit when bbox  is more when 25 square degrees

exec: pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.include("Requested area is larger than allowed for your account type (25.00 square degrees)");

request.description: This test checks if request returns error message when requested area is larger than allowed ( allowed 25.00 square degrees).

response.name: Request should return error message with square degrees limit when bbox  is more when 25 square degrees

item.name: Request should return error message when bbox instead number is given letter

request.description: This test checks if request returns error message when requested area is letter or *,-,+,/,@,$,%,^,&.

response.name: Request should return error message when bbox instead number is given letter

item.name: Request should return error message when bbox data is not a float when instead number is given #, but returns  401 - unauthorized

request.description: This test checks if request returns error code 400(bad request) and error message about not a float value when in requested area is #. Returns error code 401-Unauthorized, message-Invalid API key..It's a bug.

response.name: Request should return error message when bbox data is not a float when instead number is given #, but returns  401 - unauthorized

item.name: Request should return code error 500 Internal server error when 2.5 is not given

exec: pm.test("Error code should be 500, but not 404", function () {

request.description: I wanted to check what returns request when /2.5/ is not given ()i guess it's some internal value. I got response with 404 code-bad request, but error message - Internal Error. It would be nice to get error code 500. Sounds like a bug!

response.name: Request should return code error 500 Internal server error when 2.5 is not given
